item.title: NextJS - Lesson 1: Introduction
item.description: If you prefer the video version of this lesson, click here: Youtube Video. Hi everyone and welcome to the first lesson.

item.title: NextJS - Lesson 2: Routing
item.description: Lesson 2 complete code: üìÇ https://github.com/The-Boring-Team/nextjs-movies Introduction Hi everyone and welcome to the second lesson. In this one, we’re going to create a new page in the existing project and implement routing back and forth between the main page and the new page.

item.title: NextJS - Lesson 3: Assets, Metadata & Scripts
item.description: Lesson 3 complete code: Github Repo Introduction Hi everyone and welcome to the third lesson. Now that we have a basic understanding of routing in NextJS, let’s explore other interesting topics.

item.title: NextJS - Lesson 4: Pre-Rendering & Data Fetching
item.description: Lesson 4 complete code: Github Repo üèûÔ∏è Episode 4 slider Introduction Hi everyone and welcome to the fourth episode. Now that we understand the basics, let’s explore the core concepts behind the reason why NextJS is truly a powerful framework.

item.title: NextJS - Lesson 5: Dynamic Routes
item.description: üèûÔ∏è Episode 5 slider Github branch: here Slides: here Introduction Hi everyone and welcome to the fifth episode. In this one, we’ll explore a concept in NextJS called Dynamic Routes.

item.title: NextJS - Random Notes
item.description: Tips Since getStaticProps only runs at build time, you cannot access data that’s available only at request time, such as the HTTP headers.

item.title: NextJS Learning Journey
item.description: I’ve been curious for quite a while to learn more about NextJS, so I’m doing that! I’m researching the topic and creating written lessons/videos talking about NextJS while building a project.

item.title: NextJS Research
item.description: Episode 5: Dynamic Routes What you will learn in this episode: How to statically generate pages with dynamic routes using getStaticPaths How to write getStaticProps to fetch the data for each movie.

item.title: PSM I - Study Notes
item.description: Welcome to my study notes, explore the following question packs to learn for the PSM I certification. 80 Questions üìö Scrum Artifacts | 17 Questions

item.title: Scrum Artifacts
item.description: Question 1 What is the order of items in the Product Backlog? Answer: Less valuable and most unclear items at the bottom.

item.title: Scrum Events
item.description: Question 1 What are the Scrum Events? The Sprint Retrospective The Daily Scrum The Sprint Planning The Sprint Review Question 2 Who is allowed to participate in the Daily Scrum?

item.title: Scrum Learning Journey
item.description: I have published series of articles on Medium about my Scrum learning journey. The final purpose of the journey is to get the Professional Scrum Master 1 certification.

item.title: Scrum Roles
item.description: Question 1 What are the characteristics of a Development Team? Accountability belongs to the Development Team as a whole. Scrum recognizes no sub-teams in the Development Team.

item.title: Scrum Theory
item.description: Question 1 How frequently should scrum users inspect Scrum artifacts and progress toward a Sprint Goal? Answer: Frequently, but it should not get in the way of the work.

item.title: Scrum Values
item.description: Start of the Journey The best introduction to the Scrum Framework is by starting with its values. This is a small 5 part series going through each one: Focus, Openness, Courage, Commitment and Respect.
